title: Comprehensive Comparison of Qualitative and Quantitative Research Approaches

aspects.qualitative: Answer "Why?" question, Explore and understand phenomena
aspects.quantitative: Answer "How many/much?" question, Test and confirm hypotheses

aspects.qualitative: Grouping of common data, non-statistical analysis, Case-based descriptive or interpretive methods
aspects.quantitative: Statistical analysis, Variable-based statistical or mathematical methods

aspects.qualitative: Assumes existence of dynamic and multiple reality
aspects.quantitative: Assumes there is a single reality

aspects.qualitative: Semi-structured like in-depth interviews, observations and focus group discussions
aspects.quantitative: Highly structured methods like questionnaires, inventories and scales

aspects.qualitative: Primarily inductive to develop the theory or hypothesis
aspects.quantitative: Deductive process to test the hypothesis
Rely largely on random sampling methods

aspects.qualitative: Collect data until data saturation is achieved
Small sample size but studied in-depth
